Class HangmanGUI

java.lang.Object
HangmanGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class HangmanGUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
Handles everything related to the Hangman game and its BouncingBallsGUI
Author:
mdobroski

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Processes the button clicks like "New Game" and "Guess Letter" and does the corresponding functions that would occur in a round of hangman
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - event that gets handled by superclass, not important in this set of code

    • updateHiddenWord

      private void updateHiddenWord()
      Will update the hangman word by iterating through and cleanly printing out the word with respect to what must still be hidden by hiding those with a "_"

    • newGuess

      private boolean newGuess​(java.lang.String guessLetter)
      A new letter has been guessed so this function will go through and see if it's a match. If it is, it will update the word array list by changing the "_"'s to their respective letters and return true for yes, there was a match. In the case that there isn't a match, the function will just return false so that the original code can use that information and add a body part to the hangman.
      Parameters:
      guessLetter - the letter that is being guessed by the player
      Returns:
      true if there is a match and false if not

    • gameWon

      private boolean gameWon()
      Iterates through word to discover if there are still any "_"'s which will conclude if the game has been won
      Returns:
      true if yes you won and false if not yet
